content.question: Capacitance <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>C</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> (arbitrary units) Plate Separation <math alttext="S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> (arbitrary units) 20 80.2 40 39.8 50 32.4 70 22.8 The table above shows experimental data for the capacitance <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>C</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> of a parallel-plate capacitor as a function of the plate separation <math alttext="S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. The students who took the data neglected to record their units. Do the data support the accepted relationship between capacitance and plate separation? Why or why not?

choices.label: No, because the data show that <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>C</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is proportional to <math alttext="S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.

No, because the data show that <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>C</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is proportional to <math alttext="S squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>.

Yes, because the data show that <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>C</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is proportional to <math alttext="1 over S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>/</mo><mi>S</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.

Yes, because the data show that <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>C</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is proportional to <math alttext="1 over, S squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>/</mo><msup><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: Yes, because the data show that <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>C</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is proportional to <math alttext="1 over S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>/</mo><mi>S</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
